snippet: When Michael C. Skakel first sued a TV program for libel, lawyers countered that, as a convicted murderer, Mr. Skakel had no reputation left to lose, but now his conviction has been overturned.
abstract: Michael C Skakel initiated libel suit against television personality Nancy Grace while he was serving sentence for 1975 murder of Greenwich, Conn neighbor Martha Moxley; civil complaint charged that Grace wrongly asserted in broadcast that Skakel's DNA had been found near murder site; while Grace's attorneys contended that Skakel had no reputation to preserve, recent overturning of Skakel's conviction may change standing of suit.
lead_paragraph: When Michael C. Skakel first sued a TV program for libel, lawyers countered that, as a convicted murderer, Mr. Skakel had no reputation left to lose, but now his conviction has been overturned.

headline.main: At Issue in Skakel’s Libel Suit Against TV Host, Degrees of Tarnish on a Reputation
headline.print_headline: At Issue in Skakel’s Libel Suit Against TV Host, Degrees of Tarnish on a Reputation
